verses.kjv: And when they drew nigh unto Jerusalem, and were come to Bethphage, unto the mount of Olives, then sent Jesus two disciples,
verses.web: When they came near to Jerusalem, and came to Bethsphage, to the Mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples,
verses.ct: As they approached Jerusalem and reached Bethphage near the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent 2 disciples ahead.

verses.kjv: Saying unto them, Go into the village over against you, and straightway ye shall find an ass tied, and a colt with her: loose them, and bring them unto me.
verses.web: saying to them, “Go into the village that is opposite you, and immediately you will find a donkey tied, and a colt with her. Untie them, and bring them to me.
verses.ct: He told them, "Go into the village just ahead of you. Right away you'll find a donkey tied up with her colt beside her. Untie them and bring them to me.

verses.kjv: And if any man say ought unto you, ye shall say, The Lord hath need of them; and straightway he will send them.
verses.web: If anyone says anything to you, you shall say, ‘The Lord needs them,’ and immediately he will send them.”
verses.ct: If anyone questions you, just say, 'The Lord needs them,' and they'll let you take them immediately."

verses.kjv: All this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying,
verses.web: All this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophet, saying,
verses.ct: This happened to fulfill what the prophet had spoken:

verses.kjv: Tell ye the daughter of Sion, Behold, thy King cometh unto thee, meek, and sitting upon an ass, and a colt the foal of an ass.
verses.web: “Tell the daughter of Zion, behold, your King comes to you, humble, and riding on a donkey, on a colt, the foal of a donkey.”
verses.ct: "Tell the daughter of Zion: Look, your King is coming to you, humble and riding on a donkey — on a colt, the foal of a donkey."

verses.kjv: And the disciples went, and did as Jesus commanded them,
verses.web: The disciples went, and did just as Jesus commanded them,
verses.ct: The disciples went and did exactly what Jesus told them to do.

verses.kjv: And brought the ass, and the colt, and put on them their clothes, and they set him thereon.
verses.web: and brought the donkey and the colt, and laid their clothes on them; and he sat on them.
verses.ct: They brought the donkey and the colt, draped their cloaks over them, and Jesus sat on them.

verses.kjv: And a very great multitude spread their garments in the way; others cut down branches from the trees, and strawed them in the way.
verses.web: A very great multitude spread their clothes on the road. Others cut branches from the trees, and spread them on the road.
verses.ct: A massive crowd spread their cloaks on the road, while others cut branches from the trees and laid them along the path.

verses.kjv: And the multitudes that went before, and that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna to the son of David: Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord; Hosanna in the highest.
verses.web: The multitudes who went in front of him, and those who followed, kept shouting, “Hosanna to the son of David! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”
verses.ct: The crowds walking ahead of him and those following behind kept shouting, "Hosanna to the son of David! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!"

verses.kjv: And when he was come into Jerusalem, all the city was moved, saying, Who is this?
verses.web: When he had come into Jerusalem, all the city was stirred up, saying, “Who is this?”
verses.ct: When Jesus entered Jerusalem, the whole city was buzzing with excitement. "Who is this?" people asked.

verses.kjv: And the multitude said, This is Jesus the prophet of Nazareth of Galilee.
verses.web: The multitudes said, “This is the prophet, Jesus, from Nazareth of Galilee.”
verses.ct: The crowds answered, "This is Jesus, the prophet from Nazareth in Galilee."

verses.kjv: And Jesus went into the temple of God, and cast out all them that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of them that sold doves,
verses.web: Jesus entered into the temple of God, and drove out all of those who sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the money changers’ tables and the seats of those who sold the doves.
verses.ct: Jesus went into the temple of God and drove out everyone who was buying and selling there. He flipped over the money changers' tables and knocked over the seats of those selling doves.

verses.kjv: And said unto them, It is written, My house shall be called the house of prayer; but ye have made it a den of thieves.
verses.web: He said to them, “It is written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer,’ but you have made it a den of robbers!”
verses.ct: He told them, "Scripture says, 'My house shall be called a house of prayer,' but you've turned it into a den of thieves!"

verses.kjv: And the blind and the lame came to him in the temple; and he healed them.
verses.web: The blind and the lame came to him in the temple, and he healed them.
verses.ct: Blind and lame people came to him in the temple, and he healed them.

verses.kjv: And when the chief priests and scribes saw the wonderful things that he did, and the children crying in the temple, and saying, Hosanna to the son of David; they were sore displeased,
verses.web: But when the chief priests and the scribes saw the wonderful things that he did, and the children who were crying in the temple and saying, “Hosanna to the son of David!” they were indignant,
verses.ct: But when the chief priests and the scribes saw the amazing things he was doing — and heard children shouting in the temple, "Hosanna to the son of David!" — they were furious.

verses.kjv: And said unto him, Hearest thou what these say? And Jesus saith unto them, Yea; have ye never read, Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings thou hast perfected praise?
verses.web: and said to him, “Do you hear what these are saying?” Jesus said to them, “Yes. Did you never read, ‘Out of the mouth of babes and nursing babies you have perfected praise?’ ”
verses.ct: "Do you hear what these children are saying?" they demanded. Jesus replied, "Yes. Haven't you ever read, 'Out of the mouth of babes and nursing babies you have perfected praise'?"

verses.kjv: And he left them, and went out of the city into Bethany; and he lodged there.
verses.web: He left them, and went out of the city to Bethany, and camped there.
verses.ct: Then he left them and went out of the city to Bethany, where he spent the night.

verses.kjv: Now in the morning as he returned into the city, he hungered.
verses.web: Now in the morning, as he returned to the city, he was hungry.
verses.ct: Early the next morning, as he was heading back to the city, he was hungry.

verses.kjv: And when he saw a fig tree in the way, he came to it, and found nothing thereon, but leaves only, and said unto it, Let no fruit grow on thee henceforward for ever. And presently the fig tree withered away.
verses.web: Seeing a fig tree by the road, he came to it, and found nothing on it but leaves. He said to it, “Let there be no fruit from you forever!” Immediately the fig tree withered away.
verses.ct: He spotted a fig tree by the road and went over to it, but found nothing on it except leaves. He said to it, "May you never bear fruit again!" Instantly the fig tree withered.

verses.kjv: And when the disciples saw it, they marvelled, saying, How soon is the fig tree withered away!
verses.web: When the disciples saw it, they marveled, saying, “How did the fig tree immediately wither away?”
verses.ct: The disciples were stunned. "How did the fig tree wither so fast?" they asked.

verses.kjv: Jesus answered and said unto them, Verily I say unto you, If ye have faith, and doubt not, ye shall not only do this which is done to the fig tree, but also if ye shall say unto this mountain, Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the sea; it shall be done.
verses.web: Jesus answered them, “Most certainly I tell you, if you have faith, and don’t doubt, you will not only do what was done to the fig tree, but even if you told this mountain, ‘Be taken up and cast into the sea,’ it would be done.
verses.ct: Jesus answered, "I tell you the truth — if you have faith and don't doubt, you'll not only do what was done to this fig tree, but you could even say to this mountain, 'Be lifted up and thrown into the sea,' and it would happen.

verses.kjv: And all things, whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive.
verses.web: All things, whatever you ask in prayer, believing, you will receive.”
verses.ct: Whatever you ask for in prayer, if you believe, you will receive it."

verses.kjv: And when he was come into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came unto him as he was teaching, and said, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority?
verses.web: When he had come into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to him as he was teaching, and said, “By what authority do you do these things? Who gave you this authority?”
verses.ct: When Jesus entered the temple and began teaching, the chief priests and elders of the people approached him. "By what authority are you doing these things?" they demanded. "Who gave you this authority?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus answered and said unto them, I also will ask you one thing, which if ye tell me, I in like wise will tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.web: Jesus answered them, “I also will ask you one question, which if you tell me, I likewise will tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "I'll ask you one question first. If you answer me, I'll tell you by what authority I do these things.

verses.kjv: The baptism of John, whence was it? from heaven, or of men? And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say unto us, Why did ye not then believe him?
verses.web: The baptism of John, where was it from? From heaven or from men?” They reasoned with themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will ask us, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’
verses.ct: John's baptism — where did it come from? Was it from heaven, or was it a human invention?" They debated among themselves: "If we say, 'From heaven,' he'll ask us, 'Then why didn't you believe him?'

verses.kjv: But if we shall say, Of men; we fear the people; for all hold John as a prophet.
verses.web: But if we say, ‘From men,’ we fear the multitude, for all hold John as a prophet.”
verses.ct: But if we say, 'From men,' we have the crowd to worry about — everyone considers John a prophet."

verses.kjv: And they answered Jesus, and said, We cannot tell. And he said unto them, Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.
verses.web: They answered Jesus, and said, “We don’t know.” He also said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.ct: So they answered Jesus, "We don't know." He replied, "Then I'm not going to tell you by what authority I do these things either.

verses.kjv: But what think ye? A certain man had two sons; and he came to the first, and said, Son, go work to day in my vineyard.
verses.web: But what do you think? A man had two sons, and he came to the first, and said, ‘Son, go work today in my vineyard.’
verses.ct: But let me ask you this: A man had 2 sons. He went to the first and said, 'Son, go work in my vineyard today.'

verses.kjv: He answered and said, I will not: but afterward he repented, and went.
verses.web: He answered, ‘I will not,’ but afterward he changed his mind, and went.
verses.ct: The son answered, 'No, I won't.' But later he changed his mind and went.

verses.kjv: And he came to the second, and said likewise. And he answered and said, I go, sir: and went not.
verses.web: He came to the second, and said the same thing. He answered, ‘I’m going, sir,’ but he didn’t go.
verses.ct: Then the father went to the second son and said the same thing. He answered, 'Sure, sir, I'll go' — but he never went.

verses.kjv: Whether of them twain did the will of his father? They say unto him, The first. Jesus saith unto them, Verily I say unto you, That the publicans and the harlots go into the kingdom of God before you.
verses.web: Which of the two did the will of his father?” They said to him, “The first.” Jesus said to them, “Most certainly I tell you that the tax collectors and the prostitutes are entering into God’s Kingdom before you.
verses.ct: Which of the 2 did what his father wanted?" "The first one," they answered. Jesus said to them, "I tell you the truth — tax collectors and prostitutes are entering God's Kingdom ahead of you.

verses.kjv: For John came unto you in the way of righteousness, and ye believed him not: but the publicans and the harlots believed him: and ye, when ye had seen it, repented not afterward, that ye might believe him.
verses.web: For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you didn’t believe him, but the tax collectors and the prostitutes believed him. When you saw it, you didn’t even repent afterward, that you might believe him.
verses.ct: John came to you living a righteous life, and you didn't believe him. But the tax collectors and prostitutes did. Even after you saw that, you still refused to repent and believe him.

verses.kjv: Hear another parable: There was a certain householder, which planted a vineyard, and hedged it round about, and digged a winepress in it, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into a far country:
verses.web: “Hear another parable. There was a man who was a master of a household, who planted a vineyard, set a hedge about it, dug a wine press in it, built a tower, leased it out to farmers, and went into another country.
verses.ct: Listen to another parable: A landowner planted a vineyard, put a wall around it, dug a winepress in it, and built a watchtower. Then he leased it to some farmers and left for a distant country.

verses.kjv: And when the time of the fruit drew near, he sent his servants to the husbandmen, that they might receive the fruits of it.
verses.web: When the season for the fruit came near, he sent his servants to the farmers, to receive his fruit.
verses.ct: When harvest time came, he sent his servants to the farmers to collect his share of the fruit.

verses.kjv: And the husbandmen took his servants, and beat one, and killed another, and stoned another.
verses.web: The farmers took his servants, beat one, killed another, and stoned another.
verses.ct: But the farmers grabbed his servants — they beat one, killed another, and stoned a third.

verses.kjv: Again, he sent other servants more than the first: and they did unto them likewise.
verses.web: Again, he sent other servants more than the first: and they treated them the same way.
verses.ct: So the owner sent another group of servants, even more than the first time, and the farmers treated them the same way.

verses.kjv: But last of all he sent unto them his son, saying, They will reverence my son.
verses.web: But afterward he sent to them his son, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
verses.ct: Finally, he sent his own son, thinking, 'Surely they'll respect my son.'

verses.kjv: But when the husbandmen saw the son, they said among themselves, This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and let us seize on his inheritance.
verses.web: But the farmers, when they saw the son, said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him, and seize his inheritance.’
verses.ct: But when the farmers saw the son coming, they said to each other, 'This is the heir! Let's kill him and take his inheritance for ourselves.'

verses.kjv: And they caught him, and cast him out of the vineyard, and slew him.
verses.web: So they took him, and threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him.
verses.ct: So they grabbed him, threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him.

verses.kjv: When the lord therefore of the vineyard cometh, what will he do unto those husbandmen?
verses.web: When therefore the lord of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those farmers?”
verses.ct: Now, when the owner of the vineyard comes back, what do you think he'll do to those farmers?"

verses.kjv: They say unto him, He will miserably destroy those wicked men, and will let out his vineyard unto other husbandmen, which shall render him the fruits in their seasons.
verses.web: They told him, “He will miserably destroy those miserable men, and will lease out the vineyard to other farmers, who will give him the fruit in its season.”
verses.ct: They answered, "He'll bring those wretches to a miserable end and lease the vineyard to other farmers who will give him his share of the harvest when it's due."

verses.kjv: Jesus saith unto them, Did ye never read in the scriptures, The stone which the builders rejected, the same is become the head of the corner: this is the Lord’s doing, and it is marvellous in our eyes?
verses.web: Jesus said to them, “Did you never read in the Scriptures, ‘The stone which the builders rejected was made the head of the corner. This was from the Lord. It is marvelous in our eyes?’
verses.ct: Jesus said to them, "Have you never read in the Scriptures: 'The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone. This was the Lord's doing, and it is marvelous in our eyes'?

verses.kjv: Therefore say I unto you, The kingdom of God shall be taken from you, and given to a nation bringing forth the fruits thereof.
verses.web: “Therefore I tell you, God’s Kingdom will be taken away from you, and will be given to a nation producing its fruit.
verses.ct: That's why I'm telling you: God's Kingdom will be taken away from you and given to a people who will produce its fruit.

verses.kjv: And whosoever shall fall on this stone shall be broken: but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.
verses.web: He who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, but on whomever it will fall, it will scatter him as dust.”
verses.ct: Anyone who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, and anyone it falls on will be crushed to powder."

verses.kjv: And when the chief priests and Pharisees had heard his parables, they perceived that he spake of them.
verses.web: When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his parables, they perceived that he spoke about them.
verses.ct: When the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his parables, they realized he was talking about them.

verses.kjv: But when they sought to lay hands on him, they feared the multitude, because they took him for a prophet.
verses.web: When they sought to seize him, they feared the multitudes, because they considered him to be a prophet.
verses.ct: They wanted to arrest him, but they were afraid of the crowds, who regarded Jesus as a prophet.
